before_start: {"blocks":[{"key":"c1tbl","text":"Check the following before the session is started:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2pj4","text":"Titan LN2 tank at least 20% full.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7m32m","text":"GMS3 should be open on the K3 PC. If not, open it (takes few minutes).","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ajg9r","text":"Check that GMS3 is in Power-User mode (Help menu).","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4anp5","text":"Cross-grating grid should be on the stage.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"erlvv","text":" \n\n","type":"unstyled","depth":1,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
description: {"blocks":[{"key":"a3dsg","text":"This quick guide provides key minimal steps for preparing the Titan/SerialEM for tomogram data collection on lamella or in vitro specimens with K3 camera. paceTOMO routine is also included for a typical tomogram data collection session.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bc2sc","text":"Please note that this is not an exhaustive guide, but summarises order of key steps.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
disclaimer: {"blocks":[{"key":"95qp4","text":"DISCLAIMER – FOR INFORMATIONAL PURPOSES ONLY; USE AT YOUR OWN RISK","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7aa7h","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6g5hn","text":"The protocol content here is for informational purposes only and does not constitute legal, medical, clinical, or safety advice, or otherwise; content added to protocols.io is not peer reviewed and may not have undergone a formal approval of any kind. Information presented in this protocol should not substitute for independent professional judgment, advice, diagnosis, or treatment. Any action you take or refrain from taking using or relying upon the information presented here is strictly at your own risk. You agree that neither the Company nor any of the authors, contributors, administrators, or anyone else associated with protocols.io, can be held responsible for your use of the information contained in or linked to this protocol or any of our Sites/Apps and Services.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":160,"length":12},{"key":1,"offset":631,"length":12}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"url":"http://protocols.io"}},"1":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"url":"http://protocols.io"}}}}
guidelines: {"blocks":[{"key":"7ce5a","text":"Useful resources: ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":0,"length":18}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"49c5k","text":"SerialEM repository (Nexperion): https://serialemscripts.nexperion.net/","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":33,"length":38}],"data":{}},{"key":"88ccl","text":"SerialEM mailing list: https://bio3d.colorado.edu/SerialEM/#List","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":23,"length":41}],"data":{}},{"key":"fe8s3","text":"All SerialEM help dialogues can be accessed from SerialEM directly","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"35B64E3A325E11EE8CF80A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://serialemscripts.nexperion.net"}},"1":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"35B64E72325E11EE8CF80A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://bio3d.colorado.edu/SerialEM/#List"}}}}

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"eciti","text":"Initial configuration of Record settings:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"320n","text":"Move stage to hole position.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"abodh","text":"Do inventory in TEM UI once all temperatures shown on the screen are \u003c100K. If not already, load the cross-grating grid onto the microscope.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"c4tol","text":"Load samples into the Titan. Slot 1 is reserved for cross-grating grid, which is used for daily alignment.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9315g","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9gc8v","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"eq160","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"4guak","text":"When loading grid with lamella on to the cartridge, make sure dots are facing right and blue dot is point up to adjust the orientation of the lamella.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"aird5","text":"Decide on CDS or non-CDS mode for the data collection session in GMS3 and check that the SerialEM camera set-up is consistent with that. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dfjas","text":"CDS mode mitigates some K3 gain artefacts but will increase the data acquisition time.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"15v24","text":"Start server from icon on the desktop","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8jntk","text":"Prepare ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"98vgo","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"9miak","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"software","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"can_edit":true,"developer":"Regents of the University of Colorado","guid":"F6C56810331B11EEA70A617472CF177B","id":1606,"link":"https://bio3d.colorado.edu/SerialEM/download.html","name":"serialEM","os_name":"Win","os_version":"17763.3287","repository":"","version":"4.1.0_beta_9.64"}}}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"e3inl","text":"Make a new folder in X drive for data collection","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cttb9","text":"Find a setting file that has been recently used and start from this file: ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"aq3do","text":"The master settings can be found either from other people or your own previous settings. Copy such setting file and paste it to the current data collection folder, then rename it to a unique, informative name. For example: 20230101_name_from_name_20221231_settings.txt\n","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"20kmc","text":"To launch ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e4fq3","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"fs6pv","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"34tbc","text":"Open the Anaconda shell on the K3 PC desktop. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"260n8","text":"Use terminal with administrator privilege, then run the following command to start the software:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1lg6h","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"6denn","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"software","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"can_edit":true,"developer":"Regents of the University of Colorado","guid":"850C5470331D11EEA70A617472CF177B","id":1606,"link":"https://bio3d.colorado.edu/SerialEM/download.html","name":"serialEM","os_name":"Win","os_version":"17763.3287","repository":"","version":"4.1.0_beta_9.64"}},"1":{"type":"command","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"id":11781,"name":"conda activate serialem\ncd C:/Users/VALUEDGATANCUSTOMER/Documents/SerialEM_beta\nSerialEM.exe","os_name":"Anaconda shell","os_version":"","command_name":"start serialEM","description":"","can_edit":1,"guid":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8ed3k","text":"With flu-screen down (L1 from the control pad, or in GMS), find a completely empty square (save position as e.g. “hole”) and a square with intact film (save position as e.g. “film”).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6gs7i","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"d3e4v","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"4ccop","text":"save position function can be found in TEM UI. Tab name is 'stage2'","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5kja9","text":"in serialEM, open the newly copied settings file as well as the Navigator. Load 580x from imaging states window","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"crhv8","text":"Change IS to desired low dose data collection settings (either 42k or 53k). Double click to activate the preset.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3npcf","text":"Note the C2 aperture (typically 70 or 100 mm can be used) - this will influence the flux.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3lrj4","text":"Check View setting magnification (generally 4800x or higher) and slit is inserted for Record mag.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"63mhk","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cef85","text":"Check Record beam centering on flu-screen and check flux in GMS3 with a one-second exposure.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f0s5s","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"4mnhu","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4eh8u","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"5gej5","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8omgq","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"65pvo","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"2bga","text":"If changing any settings, click “continuous update” in SerialEM and perform changes. ","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"avndq","text":"Make sure to uncheck this once done, also save settings and update IS.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}},"1":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"9k0si","text":"To center beam with beam shift: in TEM UI, find the tab of Direct alignment -\u003e Beam shift -\u003e Use multi-X \u0026 Y knobs to center it.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}},"2":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"b3shi","text":"Note the exact flux for future uses (eps, e/A^2/s), ideally 15 eps for non-CDS or 7.5 eps for CDS through sample.","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"cfqmg","text":"Note that K3 typically requires at least 50% more flux over vacuum to achieve suitable counts with samples loaded, e.g. 22-23 eps over vacuum for non-CDS will give 10-15 eps over samples. 11-12 eps over vacuum for CDS will give 7-8 eps over samples.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1sm6s","text":"Update hardware dark reference:\nIn GMS3, find Camera tab \u003e Prepare Dark Reference.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"33bse","text":"Takes ~10 seconds.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"1tiv7","text":"GIF tune:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dik57","text":"Check beam centering on flu-screen and change spot size to achieve 50 e/p/s flux. Lift screen and unblank beam.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a329a","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"bd87","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"f85h6","text":"To center beam with beam shift: in TEM UI, find Direct alignment-\u003e Beam shift -\u003e Use multi-X \u0026 Y knobs to center it.","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"f1jln","text":"When flux achieves 50 eps, do not update the settings in serialEM because such settings will only be used for GIF tune, not for data collection.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"e9869","text":"Perform full GIF tune in GMS3 with illumination settings intended for SerialEM data collection.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4fbq3","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"ak8a","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"362p6","text":"If prompted that tuning gets worse, “keep anyway” and do not undo. This is currently a bug that prevents GMS3 from tunings GIF during the final steps.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4od65","text":"Prepare gain reference if necessary. (typically needed once a week)\n","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1ln4l","text":"It is recommended to check if the reference is needed. To perform that in GMS3: ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dap91","text":"Take a dark reference","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"albec","text":"adjust the beam intensity go to to ~15eps","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fcbr2","text":"take an 1s, 20-frame exposure\nin the Process tab, click autocorrelation and see if there is any pattern existing.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5aot9","text":"If gain reference is needed, select gain reference from GMS3 Camera drop-down tab and proceed with the prompts.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f9eed","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"d96kd","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d5l41","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"d5pbp","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"f4eu8","text":"For the first, linear gain, lower spot size (normally use spot size 1 or 2), check beam centering, withdraw slit in GMS3, unblank beam to reach ~1500 flux","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}},"1":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"c2iqa","text":"For the second, counting gain, accept default counts (15 eps for non-CDS, 7.5 eps for CDS). Revert back to original Record settings (hit Go to: Rec. in SerialEM) and adjust illumination for target counts.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

steps.section: Align the microscope with stable carbon/gold materials in the field of view (over the foil)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"bm8ob","text":"In TEM UI, move stage to foil position.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Align the microscope with stable carbon/gold materials in the field of view (over the foil)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"3p0s4","text":"Check View magnification and centering on Flu screen. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8m5qb","text":"If changing anything, tick and untick continuous update in serialEM","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Align the microscope with stable carbon/gold materials in the field of view (over the foil)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"et0ai","text":"Switch to Record magnification and find focus with GMS3 (with Live \u003e FFT window on). When FFT doesn't show any Thon rings, press L2 on the control panel to zero defocus.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Align the microscope with stable carbon/gold materials in the field of view (over the foil)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"3orl","text":"Find eucentricity with SerialEM Rough Eucentricity function. Can be found in the drop-down menu.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Align the microscope with stable carbon/gold materials in the field of view (over the foil)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"1li82","text":"Use SerialEM to autofocus to -2.5 um.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1ie93","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"1unl8","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"aurbj","text":"in the drop-down menu, find Focus/Tune -\u003e Set target to -2.5um","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

steps.section: Align the microscope with stable carbon/gold materials in the field of view (over the foil)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"evrs1","text":"Correct astigmatism by CTF in SerialEM. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"24me7","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"ccgfi","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"kk8t","text":"Settings (Focus/Tune \u003e Set CTF Aqcquire Params):","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"4i8q1","text":"Exposure time: 2 sec; Binning: 0; Drift settling: 0 sec; 1 for full-view; Smallest defocus: -1.5 um. Amount to increase underfocus 0.5","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

steps.section: Align the microscope with stable carbon/gold materials in the field of view (over the foil)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"5hqdd","text":"Coma-free alignment by CTF in SerialEM. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5r4r8","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"9881s","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"2cfgi","text":"Settings (Focus/Tune \u003e Set CTF coma-free params):","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"425sh","text":"Beam tilt: 5 mrad; 0 not to do full 3x3 array; Threshold: 0.1 mrad.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

steps.section: Align the microscope with stable carbon/gold materials in the field of view (over the foil)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"a27k","text":"Coma vs Image Shift calibration.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5ni3h","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"b22uj","text":"When the task is done, put in the C2 aperture size: 70 or 100 (check Apertures tab in TEM UI).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"61olf","text":"Uses image settings from Set CTF Acquire Params above. Only change the exposure time to 10s when necessary. ","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"8k0kl","text":"Sometimes not enough Thon rings can be used for fitting and longer exposure time can help with the issue.","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"9nnam","text":"Beam tilt: 4 mrad.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

steps.section: Aquire multiple atlases and screen the sample quality
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"5j19g","text":"Optional step: if lamella is being imaged and paceTOMO is not used, pre-tilt determination is required ahead of time.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Align the microscope with stable carbon/gold materials in the field of view (over the foil)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"c2rse","text":"Insert OA (objective aperture, 70 or 100 um) and check centering in diffraction mode (make sure the flu screen is DOWN). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6hj3j","text":"Use roll wheel to get bright view and use rings to center OA. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cmagi","text":"Change magnification to meters when rings are too small to be visualized.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d60hk","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"a23of","text":"Once done, correct astigmatism by CTF in SerialEM again.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"6tg5g","text":"To adjust the OA: in TEM UI, click Adjust in Apertures tab -\u003e use multi X \u0026 Y to adjust until the entire ring is centered","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

steps.section: Align the microscope with stable carbon/gold materials in the field of view (over the foil)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"c5p9l","text":"Align SerialEM Record/Focus/View offsets:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Align the microscope with stable carbon/gold materials in the field of view (over the foil)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"41uds","text":"Check “continuous update” in SerialEM for the low-dose IS.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a0ggq","text":"in serialEM, copy Record setting parameters to Focus and Trial settings.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"28pdp","text":"Lower down the flu-screen to check centering of Record/Focus/View settings.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Align the microscope with stable carbon/gold materials in the field of view (over the foil)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"eqq8j","text":"Check image shift for Record/View settings using a feature such as a bead on the XG grid. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ec5b3","text":"Untick “move stage for big mouse shifts” and retick once offset is set.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dp3n","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fujaf","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"5r2oo","text":"Once done, uncheck “continuous update”, save settings and update IS.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"1g2sc","text":"To adjust the image shift, use record(preview) to find a feature in the field of view -\u003e take view image -\u003e center view using right mouse-\u003e SET SHIFT under “offsets for …” in serialEM","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

steps.section: Aquire multiple atlases and screen the sample quality
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"88bep","text":"With the cross-grating loaded, switch to 135x Atlas IS.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Aquire multiple atlases and screen the sample quality
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"3jng8","text":"Set up full montage (6x9 atlas) in serialEM drop-down menu. Run MapGrids macro from script editor.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"14ru3","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"e9936","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"8nfun","text":"Adjust the following number according to the sample slots:","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"dhsu9","text":"Loop x index; – index start from 1, then loop for x times. So x equals to the number\nof grids you are planning to check","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"bbs0m","text":"i = $index + y; – y should be the slot number of your first grid - 1 since index starts from 1","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

steps.section: Aquire multiple atlases and screen the sample quality
steps.step:
{"blocks":[{"key":"cit72","text":"Inspect each atlas and decide on overall grid quality. Reloading grids will require registration alignment to account for small shifts/rotations during reloading. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2v57a","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"a8j7b","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ah8l4","text":"Change back to 135x first for all of the following alignments","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"5v6ua","text":"Registration alignment procedure: ","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"8gaom","text":"Add at least two points (on something remarkable, like a crack or large piece of ice) far from each other on the original Atlas.","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"ajgbe","text":"Mark each of these points as Registration Points using the button at the top left of the
navigator window. They should now have an indication of which registration and
which point they are in the “Reg.” column (e.g. 1R1, 1R2)","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"3094v","text":"Increase the registration from 1 to 2.","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"39ofq","text":"At the atlas mag, visit each navigation point from the original navigator: select the old
navigation point, click “Go to XYZ”, take a Record image. Locate the feature in the new image, and add it as a point in the new image. Again, select “Registration point” as before, and make sure the number matches the point in the previous registration (1R1 should match 2R1 and so on).","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"63bg6","text":"After repeating for all registration points, in Navigator menu select “Transform Items” to transform the atlas and any old points from the old registration to the new one. You can now proceed normally.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

steps.section: Aquire multiple atlases and screen the sample quality
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"4k59g","text":"Tilt stage to +40’ and take a Record image. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5k0ks","text":"Use shift+drag-left-click to measure top-to-bottom lamella length (appears in log window). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fvfa9","text":"Tilt stage to -40’ and take a Record image. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9n05v","text":"Use shift+drag-left-click to measure top-to-bottom lamella length (appears in log window).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4o5c4","text":"Whichever gives the longest distance is the direction of the pre-tilt (e.g. +/– 9 to 18’). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"55tjm","text":"Tilt stage to desired pre-tilt and stay at this angle for subsequent steps. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4b5j7","text":"*for PACEtomo routine, change the tilt back to 0° since the script calculates the tilt by itself.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Aquire multiple atlases and screen the sample quality
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"4t452","text":"Use sacrificial area on the specimen to check defocus (with target something like 4-5 um) and View/Record image shift before queueing up for data collection.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7vuc3","text":"Use vacuum area next to data collection area to re-check beam centering and ZLP.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Aquire multiple atlases and screen the sample quality
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"11avb","text":"Obtain square/lamella detailed montage/maps using los-does presets (42k or 53k)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Aquire multiple atlases and screen the sample quality
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"8cisq","text":"Insert objective aperture and check slit is inserted.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"akuje","text":"Switch to LD data collection IS (the same used for XG calibrations above) and do shift-to-marker with View using one or two square/lamella maps. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d8o12","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"fbtb2","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"79qmq","text":"To align 4800x with 580x:","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"bh8m4","text":"In the atlas, find a feature and click 'go to XYZ' in IS","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"60ul9","text":"Take a view (should be 4800x), add a green marker on the same feature. If not able to find it, use flu-screen to roughly identify it first then take a view again.","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"adfm7","text":"From drop down menu, use Navigator -\u003e shift to marker, tick 2nd options for both tabs (should be 580x to 4800x)","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"30qkb","text":"When set, go to XYZ again and take view to confirm the alignment","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

steps.section: Aquire multiple atlases and screen the sample quality
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"8qs1i","text":"Load each square/lamella map in the Navigator and add a point in the centre of the square/lamella for montage view if desired.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7ua82","text":"Set each points to “Acquire” and select “new file at item” with montage settings (provide an indexable name, e.g. squarev1.mrc). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8q07h","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"99v8q","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"fi3d7","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fc0co","text":"\t","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"1dcac","text":"2x3 at 4800x is normally sufficient for lamella.","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"7d8g8","text":"Set binning to 1 for more detailed overviews.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

steps.section: Aquire multiple atlases and screen the sample quality
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"ckuim","text":"in serialEM drop down menu, select Navigator \u003e Acquire at items. No tasks checked except for montage/map collection. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d3ikb","text":"Make sure Z height is applied by unchecking the mark. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"adsei","text":"Use LD View for montage and use stage movements. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3larh","text":"Save Navigator when done.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Aquire multiple atlases and screen the sample quality
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"3b7db","text":"Inspect detailed square/lamella montages for data collection.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Aquire multiple atlases and screen the sample quality
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"3bl9g","text":"Under Camera setup in serialEM, check exposure and frame time depending on desired total dose.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"66bq6","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ed99p","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"1lv0v","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3bl64","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"edrnj","text":"For 120e/A2 total dose, use the flux recorded previously (for example, 5.01eps to determine total exposure time:","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"418q","text":"120/37/5.01 = 0.647s, 37 is the planned total frame number ","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"5nctl","text":"In this scenario 8 frames per tilt gives 120/37/8=0.4e/A2/frame dose. Gatan suggests 0.6, so 8-frames/tilt is a good starting point.","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"70bd1","text":"Use 8 frames to determine fractionated time: 0.649/8 = 0.081s per frame","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

steps.section: Aquire multiple atlases and screen the sample quality
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"7mrcq","text":"In the same tab, set folder for frames to be saved to.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4t0v0","text":"Also set file saving options: tif (LZW compression), set filename as current open file (minus extension), sequential number starting from 0, tilt angle in name.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Aquire multiple atlases and screen the sample quality
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"55efb","text":"Add points for details of interest in the navigator. Save it when done.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ff6kh","text":"Under Low Dose control in serialEM, ensure Focus position on tilt axis is 0, i.e. the same area as Recording region.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2d44r","text":"Decide on camera and frames settings:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"17f6i","text":"Focus, Trial and Preview exposures can be set for ~ 1 e/A2, e.g. ~0.2s if dose is around 5e/A2/s","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fckhq","text":"View and Preview should have the same binning, normally 4x.
Decide on Record exposure and number of frames, ideally at least ~ 0.4 e/A2/frame.
Ensure the View defocus offset is 50 microns, rather than 150+ microns.
Record file saving options should have same root as open file (minus extension), with tilt angle and navigator item number included.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"76ao3","text":"Under Camera Setup, change the frames folder to a dedicated folder for PACE and ensure dose fractionation settings are as desired.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7f5f4","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1k9bv","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"fl8nj","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"blcm","text":"Make another directory dedicated to PACEtomo targets","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"78uch","text":"Check Tilt Axis Offset under the \"Tasks \u003e Eucentricity\" tab in serialEM is set to the calibrated value, normally -2.2 microns. This is important for a stable defocus across the tilt series.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":9,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"key":"dk2ml","text":"Important: avoid changing this in the same PACE session as it creates a conflict with the PACE directory later.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1q712","text":"Pre-run checklist:
Focus area 0 microns away.
Untick "stage shift for large mouse shifts".
OA inserted and Slit is in","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1v5i7","text":"Check desired settings in the PACEtomo.py and PACEtomo_selectTargets.py scripts.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c18sb","text":"No need to change most of the things. Check to make sure:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dj8c7","text":"zeroExpTime is set to 0, unless hybrid scheme is desired.  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6m584","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"12ng1","text":"In PACEtomo.py:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2uf10","text":"startTilt and max tilt can be changed later.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"62nuf","text":"minDefocus, maxDefocus can be -3 to -5 but can also modify later ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dt7gk","text":"delayIS and delayTilt should be 0.5 or even 1","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7tui2","text":"taOffsetPos is something like 0.8, based on Josh’s benchmarking on our Titan1 to deal with systematic defocus increase at high tilt","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"86oqt","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5giik","text":"In PACEtomo_selectTargets.py:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"67qh1","text":"Guidance is true for guided anchormap routine","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5dqo9","text":"beamDiameter should be something like 1.8 for 42x and suggested dose","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2ttr2","text":"maxTilt is ~60° for a 37-tilt tomogram","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5eu5t","text":"Inspect each lamella/square montage and decide on the number of needed PACE groups.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3jnh4","text":"Think diligently about how to arrange TS and where to place the sacrificial focus/tracking area - preferably something distinct. One can use Navigator Points on montages.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"h6h1","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"3tspg","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9ch2d","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"1j5eq","text":"Lamella can often be covered with one PACE group. But for 20+ micron length lamella, consider breaking into two PACE groups to limit 10+ micron beam shifts. Grid squares may need multiple PACE groups.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fioit","text":"For each PACE group, add Navigator points for intended acquisition areas. As always, think diligently above the beam diameter and spacing of acquisition areas.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"52q2k","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"dpaqf","text":"The first point in the group must be the focus/tracking area and have enough features, e.g. a mitochondrion, a multi-lamella body, bacterial cell, etc.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"osit","text":"To be considered one group, the points must be added in the same cycle of Add Points / Stop Adding in the Navigator.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"esoqo","text":"Select this first point in group and move stage to XYZ in navigator. Autofocus to -4 μm here.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a8o3t","text":"Make sure \"move stage for big mouse shifts\" is unticked.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bhlgt","text":"Verify grouping by clicking 'collapse' in the Navigator and checking the desired number of acquisition points, including the focus/tracking position.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ljte","text":"With the first item in the group highlighted, run PACEtomo_selectTargets from the editor and follow the prompts.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"63c9l","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"cqboj","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"6rlnc","text":"First, give the PACE root a logical and consistent name for the lamella/square, e.g. \"L1\" or \"Sq1\", with a PACE group identifier if collecting multiple groups on the same lamella/square, e.g. \"L1_P1\" or \"Sq1_P1\".","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"2lc5r","text":"After that, the script will guide you to finalize the targeting positions of all points in this group. ","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"3a6v8","text":"One can add more targets when all targets are refined following the guidance.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"vcd6","text":"In the targets GUI, assign at least three additional focus positions with mouse middle-clicks in vacant areas, hit \"measure geometry\" and wait. Note the estimated pre-tilt and rotation for this group.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2uen2","text":"Put in the number for tilt angles and steps based on the estimated pre-tilt. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6cqbv","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"9qri0","text":"Once done, Save the targets file and close it.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6ppot","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1st7v","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"a0k6","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"1q71g","text":"Note the number put in is negative to the estimation: the start tilt should be the opposite sign of the estimated pre-tilt and rounded to a multiple of the step (e.g. estimate pre-tilt of -10 would have a start tilt of +9 for a tilt step of 3). ","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"tjde","text":"Make sure the min/max tilts account for the pre-tilt (e.g. +/- 48 from a 12 pre-tilt would be -36 to 60).","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}},"1":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"a7v8t","text":"The Navigator should now list all the queued areas for this group. The first point (focus/tracking) should automatically be set to Acquire (\"A\") with the target text file next to it.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"784ai","text":"Repeat above steps for each PACE group.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"84q32","text":"Go to \"Navigator \u003e Acquire at Items\" to run the PACEtomo script at each group. Turn off defocus cycling/focus and make sure \"Manage Dewars\" is always checked.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
